title: List Directory Contents
description: The 'ls' command lists directory contents. You can use options to show detailed information, hidden files, and sort the output in various ways.

title: Change Directory
description: The 'cd' command changes the current directory to a specified path. Use '..' to move up one level, or specify an absolute or relative path.

title: Print Working Directory
description: The 'pwd' command prints the full path of the current working directory, which is useful to confirm where you are in the file system.

title: Create Directory
description: The 'mkdir' command creates one or more directories. You can also use the '-p' option to create parent directories as needed.

title: Remove Directory
description: The 'rmdir' command removes empty directories. To delete non-empty directories, use the 'rm' command with the '-r' option.

title: Remove Files and Directories
description: The 'rm' command removes files or directories. Use the '-r' option to remove directories and their contents recursively.

title: Copy Files
description: The 'cp' command copies files or directories. To copy directories, use the '-r' option for recursive copying.

title: Move or Rename Files
description: The 'mv' command moves or renames files or directories. To rename, provide the old and new file names.

title: Display File Contents
description: The 'cat' command displays the contents of a file, combining multiple files, or creating new ones.

title: Search Text in Files
description: The 'grep' command searches for text in files and displays matching lines. Use options like '-r' for recursive search in directories.

title: Find Files by Name
description: The 'find' command searches for files and directories within the specified directory. You can search by name, size, or other properties.

title: Change File Permissions
description: The 'chmod' command changes the file permissions of a file or directory. It can be used with numeric or symbolic notation.

title: Change File Ownership
description: The 'chown' command changes the ownership of files and directories. You can specify both the user and group ownership.

title: Create Symbolic Link
description: The 'ln' command creates a link to a file. By default, it creates hard links, but you can use the '-s' option to create symbolic links.

title: View Running Processes
description: The 'ps' command provides information about the currently running processes. It is commonly used with the 'aux' options to display all processes.

title: Terminate a Process
description: The 'kill' command sends a signal to a process, usually to terminate it. You can specify the process ID (PID) to stop it.

title: Monitor System Resources
description: The 'top' command provides real-time information about the system's resource usage, including CPU and memory usage.

title: Download Files from the Web
description: The 'wget' command retrieves files from the web using HTTP, HTTPS, and FTP protocols. It is commonly used for downloading large files.

title: Transfer Files via SSH
description: The 'scp' command copies files over SSH. It is useful for securely transferring files between computers on a network.

title: Check Disk Usage
description: The 'du' command estimates file space usage, providing a summary of the disk usage of files and directories.

title: Display Free Disk Space
description: The 'df' command displays the amount of available disk space on the file system, including details about each mounted partition.

title: Archive Files
description: The 'tar' command is used to archive multiple files into one archive file, and extract them when needed. It supports compression with gzip and bzip2.

title: Compress Files
description: The 'gzip' command compresses files to reduce file size. It is often used with 'tar' to create compressed archive files.

title: Decompress Files
description: The 'gunzip' command decompresses files that were compressed with 'gzip'.

title: Change Password
description: The 'passwd' command changes the password for a user account.

title: Ping Network Host
description: The 'ping' command checks the connectivity to a network host by sending ICMP echo request packets.

title: Display Network Interfaces
description: The 'ifconfig' command displays information about the network interfaces on the system, and can be used to configure them.

title: Show Open Network Connections
description: The 'netstat' command displays active network connections, routing tables, and interface statistics.

title: Display Current Date and Time
description: The 'date' command displays the current date and time. You can also use it to set the system date and time.

title: Shutdown System
description: The 'shutdown' command brings the system down in a secure way. You can specify a time delay or schedule a shutdown.

title: Reboot System
description: The 'reboot' command reboots the system. It's often used after performing system maintenance.

title: Search for Packages
description: The 'apt-cache search' command searches for available packages in the APT package manager repositories.

title: Install Packages
description: The 'apt-get install' command installs packages using the APT package manager in Debian-based systems.

title: Update Package Lists
description: The 'apt-get update' command updates the package lists for upgrades and new installations.

title: Upgrade Installed Packages
description: The 'apt-get upgrade' command upgrades all installed packages to the newest available versions.

title: Install RPM Packages
description: The 'rpm -i' command installs RPM packages on Red Hat-based distributions.

title: List Installed RPM Packages
description: The 'rpm -qa' command lists all installed RPM packages on the system.

title: Check Memory Usage
description: The 'free' command displays the total, used, and available system memory.

title: Create a New User
description: The 'useradd' command creates a new user account.

title: Change User Password
description: The 'passwd' command changes the password of a user account.

title: Delete a User
description: The 'userdel' command deletes a user account and optionally the home directory.

title: Add a Group
description: The 'groupadd' command creates a new group.

title: Add User to Group
description: The 'usermod -aG' command adds a user to a group.

title: Show System Information
description: The 'uname -a' command displays detailed information about the system, including kernel version and architecture.

title: View Disk Partitions
description: The 'fdisk -l' command lists all disk partitions.

title: Format a Disk
description: The 'mkfs' command creates a file system on a partition or disk.

title: Mount a File System
description: The 'mount' command mounts a file system to a directory.

title: Unmount a File System
description: The 'umount' command unmounts a file system from a directory.

title: Check Disk for Errors
description: The 'fsck' command checks and repairs file systems.

title: Show IP Address
description: The 'ip addr show' command displays IP addresses for all network interfaces.

title: Check System Uptime
description: The 'uptime' command shows how long the system has been running.

title: Show Command History
description: The 'history' command displays a list of previously executed commands.

title: Display Disk Space Usage
description: The 'df -h' command displays disk space usage in a human-readable format.

title: Check Available Updates
description: The 'apt-get upgrade' command checks and installs available updates for packages.

title: Compress File with bzip2
description: The 'bzip2' command compresses files using the bzip2 algorithm.

title: Decompress bzip2 Files
description: The 'bunzip2' command decompresses bzip2 compressed files.

title: Monitor Real-Time Logs
description: The 'tail -f' command displays new log entries in real-time.

title: Show Last System Boot Logs
description: The 'dmesg' command displays the kernel ring buffer logs, including system boot messages.

title: Monitor System Performance
description: The 'vmstat' command displays real-time information about system performance, including CPU, memory, and I/O statistics.

title: Schedule a Task with Cron
description: The 'crontab' command is used to schedule tasks to run at specific times or intervals using cron jobs.

title: Show Crontab Entries
description: The 'crontab -l' command lists all cron jobs scheduled for the current user.

title: Check System Logs
description: The 'journalctl' command is used to query and display logs from the systemd journal.

title: Enable a Service
description: The 'systemctl enable' command enables a systemd service to start at boot.

title: Start a Service
description: The 'systemctl start' command starts a systemd service immediately.

title: Restart a Service
description: The 'systemctl restart' command restarts a systemd service.

title: Stop a Service
description: The 'systemctl stop' command stops a running systemd service.

title: Check Service Status
description: The 'systemctl status' command shows the current status of a systemd service.

title: Disable a Service
description: The 'systemctl disable' command prevents a systemd service from starting at boot.

title: Check Available Disk Space
description: The 'df' command reports the disk space usage for file systems. Use '-h' for human-readable output.

title: Kill All Processes by Name
description: The 'killall' command kills all processes by name.

title: Check Open Files by Process
description: The 'lsof' command lists open files and the processes that opened them.

title: Track Network Connections
description: The 'ss' command displays detailed information about network connections and sockets.

title: Flush DNS Cache
description: The 'systemd-resolve --flush-caches' command flushes the DNS cache on a system using systemd-resolved.

title: Show Disk IO Statistics
description: The 'iostat' command shows CPU and input/output statistics for devices and partitions.

title: Display Detailed Memory Usage
description: The 'smem' command displays detailed memory usage per process.

title: Check CPU Information
description: The 'lscpu' command provides detailed information about the CPU architecture.

title: Check Kernel Version
description: The 'uname -r' command displays the current Linux kernel version.

title: Display Mounted File Systems
description: The 'mount' command lists all currently mounted file systems.

title: Monitor Disk Activity
description: The 'iotop' command displays a list of processes performing disk I/O, sorted by I/O usage.

title: Search for a File
description: The 'locate' command quickly finds the location of files on your system by searching an index.

title: Update Locate Database
description: The 'updatedb' command updates the database used by the 'locate' command.

title: Show Disk Usage by File
description: The 'du' command shows the disk usage of files and directories.

title: Trace Network Path
description: The 'traceroute' command shows the route packets take to a network destination.

title: Check Network Latency
description: The 'ping' command sends ICMP packets to test network connectivity and measure round-trip time.

title: Download File from Internet
description: The 'curl -O' command downloads a file from the internet and saves it with the same name as the source.

title: Download with Wget
description: The 'wget' command downloads files from the internet.

title: Create a Swap File
description: The 'dd' command creates a swap file for additional memory.

title: Enable Swap Space
description: The 'swapon' command enables swap space on a file or partition.

title: Disable Swap Space
description: The 'swapoff' command disables swap space on a file or partition.

title: Change File Owner
description: The 'chown' command changes the ownership of files or directories.

title: Change File Permissions
description: The 'chmod' command changes the permissions of a file or directory.

title: Change File Timestamps
description: The 'touch' command updates the access and modification times of a file. It can also create an empty file.

title: Search Command History
description: The 'history' command shows the list of previously executed commands.

title: Clear Command History
description: The 'history -c' command clears the shell's command history.

title: Backup Files with Rsync
description: The 'rsync' command synchronizes files between two locations, useful for backups.

title: Create a File Archive
description: The 'tar -czvf' command compresses files and directories into a single archive file.

title: Extract a Tar Archive
description: The 'tar -xzvf' command extracts a compressed tar archive.

title: Install a Package
description: The 'apt-get install' command installs software packages on Debian-based systems.

title: Update Package List
description: The 'apt-get update' command updates the package lists for upgrades or new installations.

title: Upgrade Installed Packages
description: The 'apt-get upgrade' command upgrades all installed packages to their latest versions.

title: Remove a Package
description: The 'apt-get remove' command removes a package from the system.

title: Search for a Package
description: The 'apt-cache search' command searches for a package in the repositories.

title: Show Package Information
description: The 'apt-cache show' command displays detailed information about a package.

title: Create a New User
description: The 'useradd' command adds a new user to the system.

title: Delete a User
description: The 'userdel' command removes a user account and related files from the system.

title: Change User Password
description: The 'passwd' command changes a user's password.

title: Check Free Memory
description: The 'free -h' command displays the amount of free and used memory in the system in human-readable format.

title: Show Network Configuration
description: The 'ip a' command displays detailed information about the network interfaces.

title: Restart Networking Service
description: The 'systemctl restart networking' command restarts the network service.

title: Check Open Ports
description: The 'ss -tuln' command displays open ports and their status.

title: Monitor Network Traffic
description: The 'iftop' command displays a real-time view of network traffic by connection.

title: Block a Port with UFW
description: The 'ufw deny' command blocks access to a specific port.

title: Allow a Port with UFW
description: The 'ufw allow' command opens access to a specific port.

title: Enable UFW Firewall
description: The 'ufw enable' command activates the firewall rules.

title: Disable UFW Firewall
description: The 'ufw disable' command deactivates the firewall.

title: Check UFW Status
description: The 'ufw status' command displays the current firewall status and rules.

title: Change Hostname
description: The 'hostnamectl set-hostname' command changes the system hostname.

title: Check Hostname
description: The 'hostname' command displays the current system hostname.

title: Set Timezone
description: The 'timedatectl set-timezone' command sets the system timezone.

title: Check Current Time
description: The 'date' command displays the current system date and time.

title: Display Disk Partitions
description: The 'fdisk -l' command lists all disk partitions.

title: Check File System Disk Space
description: The 'df -h' command shows file system disk space usage in human-readable format.

title: Check Disk Usage by Directory
description: The 'du -sh' command displays disk usage of a directory in human-readable format.

title: Unmount a File System
description: The 'umount' command unmounts a file system.

title: Mount a File System
description: The 'mount' command mounts a file system.

title: Display Block Devices
description: The 'lsblk' command displays information about block devices.

title: Display Inode Information
description: The 'df -i' command displays inode usage of file systems.

title: List Disk Usage for Files
description: This command lists the top 10 largest files on the system.

title: Compress a File with Gzip
description: The 'gzip' command compresses files using the gzip algorithm.

title: Uncompress a Gzip File
description: The 'gunzip' command uncompresses files compressed by gzip.

title: Create a Zip Archive
description: The 'zip' command compresses files into a zip archive.

title: Extract a Zip Archive
description: The 'unzip' command extracts files from a zip archive.

title: Sync File Systems
description: The 'sync' command ensures that all data in memory is written to disk.

title: Remove a Directory
description: The 'rmdir' command removes an empty directory.

title: Force Remove Files
description: The 'rm -rf' command forcefully removes files and directories.

title: Display Running Processes
description: The 'ps aux' command lists all running processes.

title: Terminate a Process
description: The 'kill' command sends a signal to terminate a process by PID.

title: Display Process Tree
description: The 'pstree' command displays a tree of running processes.

title: Monitor System in Real-Time
description: The 'top' command provides real-time system monitoring, including CPU and memory usage.

title: Monitor Disk Activity
description: The 'iotop' command shows disk I/O usage by process.

title: Monitor Memory Usage
description: The 'htop' command is an interactive system-monitoring tool, showing real-time usage of CPU, memory, and processes.

title: Display User Information
description: The 'id' command displays user identity information, including UID and GID.

title: Display Last Logins
description: The 'last' command shows the last logged-in users.

title: Show Current Users
description: The 'w' command displays a list of logged-in users and their activities.

title: Log Out User
description: The 'pkill -KILL -u' command forces a user to log out by killing their session.

title: Display Environment Variables
description: The 'printenv' command displays all environment variables.

title: Set Environment Variable
description: The 'export' command sets a new environment variable or modifies an existing one.

title: Show Available Shells
description: The 'chsh -l' command lists all available shells on the system.

title: Change Default Shell
description: The 'chsh' command changes the default shell for the user.

title: Run Command as Another User
description: The 'su' command switches to another user account to run commands.
